snippet: A defense expert said Pedro Hernandez, who told the police he strangled Etan Patz, was incapable of understanding his right to remain silent.
abstract: Psychologist Bruce Frumkin testifies that Pedro Hernandez, man accused of strangling Etan Patz in 1979, was not mentally capable of understanding that he could invoke his right to remain silent during interviews with detectives and a prosecutor; hearing will determine whether Hernandez's videotaped confessions will be admitted at trial.
lead_paragraph: A defense expert said Pedro Hernandez, who told the police he strangled Etan Patz, was incapable of understanding his right to remain silent.

headline.main: Defendant in Etan Patz Case Is Called Unfit to Confess
headline.print_headline: Patz Defendant Called Unfit to Confess
